page.title: 03Castle Cornet, Guernsey
page.content: Dominating the approaches to Guernsey's main town and harbour, Castle Cornet has stood guard for nearly eight centuries. The Castle is open daily from April to October and receives some 60,000 visitors annually. A daily guided tour is available and as well as the structural layout of the Castle visitors can see a selection of museums such as the Armoury or the museum of the R.A.F. 201 squadron. There are also a castle shop and refectory. The firing of the noonday gun is performed each weekday by a Castle keeper in colourful uniform. Perhaps appearing a little severe by day the Castle makes a beautiful sight when floodlit on a summer night. Future plans include creating a display area for the Roman wreck.
